title: What can you do with Python?
content:
I'm a web designer with low level PHP skills. I'm also a budding type designer. Somehow, I have to convince my boss that it is a good idea for me to learn [Python](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203173616/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Python).

So my question is, aside from using the Django frameworks which I am already tentatively working with, what else could I possibly use as an argument to let me spend company time learning Python? Specifically, what can I do with it that will best build the skills needed to use Python effectively in working specifically with type, but also are productive for Python use in general?
author: DanGayle

comments.content: And thank you Just van Rossum. Drawbot seems like a perfect environment for beginning with Python.
FontForge is scriptable with Python. Don't know anything about it beyond that, but I'd like to learn too. That one might be _too_ type specific for your immediate needs though.

Learning to properly use FontForge is also a goal of mine, so that's not too far out of place.

Learning the basics of scripting is what I need to do, I guess. I'm not too familiar with creating \_any\_ kind of scripting, aside from some relatively minor PHP or jQuery.
